alert.note: Alert for Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 29 at 4:07AM EDT until July 29 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... The North Fork of the Kentucky River at Hazard, affecting Perry County. ...A FLOOD WARNING IS NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...The Flood Warning is for the North Fork of the Kentucky River at Hazard. * WHEN...The Flood Warning is in effect through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Flooding begins in some basements. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM EDT Friday the stage was 24.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 AM EDT Friday was 25.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 5.8 feet early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.0 feet on 02/18/1956. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. The next statement will be issued by noon.
